conclusion: Analyze the flow paths from points A, B, and C to determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into.
The liquid flows downward from A.
It encounters a baffle that directs it to the right.
The liquid continues to flow rightward and reaches the bottom.
The liquid flows downward from B.
It encounters a baffle that directs it to the right.
The liquid continues to flow rightward and reaches the bottom.
The liquid flows downward from C.
It encounters a baffle that directs it to the right.
The liquid continues to flow rightward and reaches the bottom.
All three flow paths (A, B, and C) direct the liquid into container D.
The liquid will flow into container D after passing through the baffles.
